channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024031361
item.description:
Report X-2024031361

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found in unload wet and placed in a lined hazmat bin for QA to inspect. Upon inspection both caps were loose and leaked internally. Moved to a well ventilated area. DescribePack: Both caps were loose and leaked internally. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tightened lids and made sure containers placed upright and placed in hazmat bin to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024031308
item.description:
Report X-2024031308

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: PANAMA CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Over radio package handler called out at high tower 3 that they had a hazardous package on the belt. Package handler sent down package via chute. QA came as soon as package was sent down and saw small grains from inside one of the packages. After inspection found that the bottom base had cracked and leaked out. Package was moved into a tote and brought to the Hazmat cage for documentation. DescribePack: Container suffered a crack at the base, notably similar to a previous damaged hazmat reported earlier this month. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was moved prior to inspection, and placed back into tote for transport to hazmat cage after inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024031080
item.description:
Report X-2024031080

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN TAMPLA, FL, AN AEROSOL RATTLE SOUND WAS HEARD COMING FROM A PACKAGE. THE TOP FLAP OF THE BOX HAD ALSO COLLAPSED REQUIRING A REWRAP. DURING CONTENT INSPECTION THERE IS AN INNER UN SPECIFICATION BOX PREPRINTED WITH A LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING. INVOICE INSIDE THE BOX LISTS AERO - 12 OZ AS A DESCRIPTION. PACKAGE CONTAINS 24 X 12 OZ AEROSOL CANS OF ARDEX ENGINE ENAMEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM TAMPA FLORIDA USING UPS ACCOUNT 4T7C5C, ARDEX, 2050 BYBERRY RD, PHILADELPHIA PA 19116.

item.title: Report X-2024031284
item.description:
Report X-2024031284

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was leaking on the 100/200 Belt. The top and side was wet. It was taken to the HazMat Cage within a red tote and HazMat bag. DescribePack: The top and a side of the box was wet. One cap was loose. There were no seals under the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The van-line admin had already isolated it to a red tote and HazMat bag before I arrived. I used the same tote to move it into the HazMat Cage.

item.title: Report X-2024031178
item.description:
Report X-2024031178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived to the destination station missing the hazardous materials certification document. It was found leaking and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: The plastic pail was shipped inside a box and it spilled from a loose lid. About 10 ounces were released. No inner packaging materials were used. Too much empty space was left inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of the damaged package it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded to a van when it was discovered wet. Then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of Stat Lab decalcifier leaked from loose caps. The bottles had a seal but the caps were not secured. No inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report E-2024030476
item.description:
Report E-2024030476

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 19, 2024, two (2) one-gallon jugs of UN1789 were damaged during a load shift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel removed the damaged bottles and placed them in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew then overpacked the impacted boxes in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024030968

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. received off trailer 806563, damaged, out of 381-MEMP. DescribePack: Pkg. was leaking from bottom, taken to QA for further inspection. Upon inspecting contents, it was noted that the bottom had a crack, which caused the material to leak out, around 12 oz. Pkg. had orientation arrows on the outside, no material inside to protect the container. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. placed inside bin, stored in the HMPA; awaiting instructions from PGH.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be leaking during delivery. DescribePack: A cap of the a bottle was loose which allowed the contents to spill inside the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic bag and separated from the other packages.
